The biomass group has been at the forefront of developing and applying methods to investigate the Soil Microbial Biomass over the last three decades.

We have a laboratory manual that you can download (click link on left) which covers some of the methods we routinely use. Please note that some of the content is specific to particular analytical equipment, so it may be advisable to only print out relevant sections, rather than all 66 pages.
1.1 Soil dry matter content and water holding capacity
1.3 Procedure for use of imported soil
1.4 Protocol for density size fractionation of small soil samples
3.1 Soil CO2 evolution and N mineralisation mineralization
4.2 Procedure for measurement of PLFAs on Gas Chromatogram
